posts.name: scott-signal
posts.cooked:
Hello everyone! The Signal team is releasing a new version of Signal Desktop, v7.49.0-beta.1. If you’re interested in participating, join the beta here.

Release notes:

  • If you link a new Desktop on Signal Android and choose to transfer your message history, now you can also selectively transfer old attachments from your primary device too. Bring the past into the present by scrolling back in time and clicking on the download icon. As always, the transfer process is end-to-end encrypted and secure.

Commit changes: Comparing v7.48.0-beta.1…v7.49.0-beta.1 · signalapp/Signal-Desktop · GitHub

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming Desktop 7.48 release

posts.cooked:
New Version: 7.49.0-beta.1

51 new commits since 7.48.0-beta.1:

Show commits

  • v7.49.0-alpha.1 [1]

  • Use @signalapp/sqlcipher [2]

  • ICU book workflow [3]

  • Support idle primary device warning alert from server [4]

  • Upgrade electron-builder to 26.0.10 to fix packaging for pnpm [5]

  • Ensure that download is no longer pending on abort [6]

  • Prefer article modified times in link preview descriptions [7]

  • Remove unused .node file on win/linux [8]

  • Ignore electron-winstaller dependency [9]

  • Relax media checks in calling lobbies [10]

  • Fix sequencing of call state updates [11]

  • Ensure that send proceeds even if quote thumbnail attachment not found [12]

  • Upgrade electron to 35.0.2 [13]

  • Fix error in 'before each' hook [14]

  • Compose: Show 'search for username' by itself more often [15]

  • Fix github actions to specific commit hashes [16]

  • Message Request UI Improvements (#9938) [17]

  • Skip building x64/arm64 dmg for macOS [18]

  • Build native dependencies in parallel [19]

  • Fix installer size dd script [20]

  • MessageReceipts: Removed dropped receipts from cache and database [21]

  • Composer: Properly update quill state on clipboard cut [22]

  • Fix alignment of control rows in settings window [23]

  • didSendToEveryone: Handle situations where you didn't send to yourself [24]

  • Composer: Better handle option-delete keypresses on macOS [25]

  • Proper caching for batched statements [26]

  • Composer/cut: Rely on Quill to update both DOM and its internal state [27]

  • Release notes for 7.48 [28]

  • Update strings [29]

  • Update DNS fallback [30]

  • Hot socket [31]

  • callStateChange: Properly handle ReceivedOfferWhileActive event [32]

  • Group Send Endorsements: Don't fetch blocked groups [33]

  • Fix incremental video playback when file is downloaded quickly [34]

  • CompositionInput: Run onBackspace no matter the modifiers [35]

  • Update to RingRTC v2.50.3 [36]

  • Improve error messaging for startup database error [37]

  • Attachment backfill [38]

  • Add backfillError to AttachmentType [39]

  • Allow clicking on narrow version of idle primary device warning [40]

  • Bump electron from 35.0.2 to 35.1.0 [41]

  • Allow backfill for more undownloadable attachments [42]

  • Fun picker improvements [43]

  • Highlight components in ICU Book [44]

  • Fix scheduling of paging queries [45]

  • Fix avatar background aliasing [46]

  • Backfill improvements [47]

  • Fun picker fixes [48]

  • Release notes for 7.49 [49]

  • Update strings [50]

  • 7.49.0-beta.1 [51]

Localization changes for the release are the same, as this is the first build of the release.
If anyone on Linux could test the Wayland window resize fix that came with electron 35.1 (included in Signal 7.49 beta), I’d be most interested in hearing.

scott-signal:

now you can also selectively transfer old attachments from your primary device too

Does this mean attachments older than the current 45 days limit can be transferred too? If that be the case, does it need the latest beta on android as well?

posts.name: Talya (she/her)
posts.cooked: and additional question - does this also apply to desktop installations that did the migration before 7.49, i.e. that have the full message history but not the media history?

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked: HUGE news actually. I was not expecting this (or missed it entirely)

posts.name: scott-signal
posts.cooked:
@gogol Yes, messages older than the 45 day limit are transferred by your primary when desktop requests them.

@rassilon1963 Yes, it works even if you have an old Link&Sync install. Or, some other odd situation where an old message attachment never loaded on Desktop but did load on your primary.

posts.name: Talya (she/her)
posts.cooked:
scott-signal:

Yes, it works even if you have an old Link&Sync install.

hell yeah

posts.name: Fedor Indutny
posts.cooked: @rassilon1963 @Whatnoww please let me know if you’ll find any issues! Hope it works well for you

Installed on Linux and linked to my Android phone, which runs production from Google Play, currently 7.37.4. The message history transferred but media only went back to 45 days. Did I miss some option to transfer more media or do I need a newer release running on Android too?
Holy shit this is awesome!

Huge News…thanks for this…

Tried two scenarios after upgrading to 7.49 beta on Linux. I had already linked and synced from my primary about a couple of weeks back. After upgrading to 7.49, can’t find the download link for older than 45 days attachments.
Deleted all data and did a relink and sync… same results. old attachments show as placeholders and clicking them pops up a message that
Media and files older than 45 days at the time of device linking can not be synced.
I don’t see any download icon for these files in the UI.
I’m on production version 7.36 on Android.

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked: This seems to be a valid username but I am entirely unable to add it via desktop, yet via link, it’ll show up like this.

New Version: 7.49.0-beta.2

  • Parallelize get-strings [1]

  • beforeMessageSend: Properly update last message with active send [2]

  • Fix rendering non/overly-qualified emoji in emojify [3]

  • Update strings [4]

  • 7.49.0-beta.2 [5]

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked:
Some stickers are not received properly now and display like an octet stream.

https://debuglogs.org/desktop/7.49.0-beta.2/16605de80006c95e1c92a361ad74975e2e361d17d7bcc0891c19eb02f008aa47.gz

1743274446032

No issues on Android.

I know I always say the same thing. But this is new. I am using Signal desktop for work since years. And only since a few weeks the startup takes ages!! Unbearable. I can’t be the only one.

https://debuglogs.org/desktop/7.46.0/efb7a0f380e97e1f72f530503f17592790046853911c212781971ff5f1bfab8b.gz

Probably the result of syncing 45 days of media.

scott-signal:

Yes, messages older than the 45 day limit are transferred by your primary when desktop requests them.

No. If you look into the logs you’ll see that it was off only for a few minutes. And as said: I have already reinstalled and resynced Signal desktop, installed from flatpak, from rpm, …

Is there no indication in my logs that show what the problem is? It happens on several computers with different versions of Signal (beta and also non beta now). Flatpak and rpm.

All my cpu cores (on the 6 core computer, on the 4 core computer, on the 8 core computer) are working hard when I start Signal. I’ve just tried it again. Closed Signal and now restarting after only a few seconds. There can’t be many new messages, if only one.

I will capture a new debug log as soon as Signal has finally started up.

Also taking/creating the debug log takes very long compared to taking it on my android phone.

https://debuglogs.org/desktop/7.46.0/ae59c0d93a5137b924887239c4e016acf94b9c468dfa60e75362c8c70ec85958.gz

Edit: Updating Signal right now on this computer, as I noticed it wasn’t a recent version. Let’s see if that was already repaired.

Edit 2: No changes. The startup took again several minutes, after having Signal closed for only a few minutes. There were no new messages.

https://debuglogs.org/desktop/7.48.0/c31ae71fc7e0fef16c6f3880950b517db62b0d7f4924e91e2338a437bd98eaf2.gz

posts.name: Jamie Kyle
posts.cooked:
It’s probably been too many days since you posted this that the relevant logs will have been deleted, but could you try again and share a debuglog?

It would be useful to get the ones from your primary device as well

Signal Support

Debug Logs and Crash Reports

We want our messaging and calling features to work seamlessly at all times. Thanks for reaching out to us about the issues you’re experiencing and being willing to provide information that will hel...

posts.name: Fedor Indutny
posts.cooked: We just released an Android 7.39.0 Beta that has the support for backfill. Sorry for the lack of synchronization between the releases. If you update to the latest, it hopefully will work this time!
